sub_title: Health Education Advisor at KIT Royal Tropical Institute
summary:
I am Elaine, a social scientist interested in how the affordances of the digital platforms can give inputs on social sciences and public health research topics. 
Are these platforms non-human actors on technoscience?

Bellow, a bit more about me. 
***
Psychologist, Master and PhD in Collective Health/Public Health, passionate for translating knowledge and designing ideas. I research the dynamics of scientific knowledge circulation and its uses, benefits and consequences to different stakeholders in a media- and technologic-oriented society.  

With my expertise on topics such as social sciences, mixed methods, digital research and public engagement, I advocate for a socially engaged science and its applicability on health behaviour and bioethics affairs. Recently, I have taken in a more in-depth look into the engines of innovative cooperation for sustainable choices in scenarios of uncertainty (like epidemics and controversies) and the dynamics of science practices around the world. 

Currently, I am interested in how technologies (AI, algorithms, digital platforms and devices, etc.) are mediating the relationship between public actors and citizens, and how this mediation shapes trust and promotes health and sustainable life. I am available for opportunities to share and contribute to projects and initiatives related to mapping, analysing and improving the production, communication and dissemination of scientific innovation to stakeholders and society.

school.name: Escola Politécnica de Saúde Joaquim Venâncio / FIOCRUZ

awards.title: Altimetric Research Award
awards.description: The Altmetric Research Award was launched in 2016 to support groundbreaking altmetrics research worldwide. Fabio and Elaine are now among an international cohort of award winners who have studied topics such as research impact in public policy, Wikipedia, and WeChat, as well as developing altmetrics for creative arts faculty. With the funding from Altmetric, they hope to understand the evolution of topics during the first six months of the Covid-19 pandemic in the titles of news, blogs and Facebook, and to be able to distinguish possible differences in science communication among these altmetrics sources.

contributors.headline: Health Education Advisor at KIT Royal Tropical Institute

projects.title: Ciências Sociais e Humanidades frente à Epidemia de Zika Vírus no Brasil
projects.description:
The objective of this research project is to investigate the social and epistemological processes related to the emergence and impact of the Zika virus (ZIKV) epidemic from 2015, as a social and health problem in Brazil and on a global scale. The project is the result of the link established by Fiocruz with the ZIKAlliance Research Consortium. ZIKAlliance is an organisation that maintains a commitment to fifty-two global partners, is multidisciplinary in nature and is coordinated by Inserm, the French National Institute of Health and Medical Research. In this context, the project Social Sciences and Humanities facing the Zika Virus Epidemic in Brazil was the Workpackge number seven (WP7) of the ZIKAlliance Research Consortium. Currently, the project is composed of four central study axes, which will combine quantitative and qualitative methods in different strategies, each approaching various aspects of the research. One of the primary research strategies links the construction of scientific history with the social and political analysis of the Zika epidemic. We hope to develop guidelines for coping with the Zika Virus and similar outbreaks, as well as protocols and methodologies for health research and action in scenarios of scientific uncertainty.
Funding: ZIKAlliance / H2020 / European Comission.

contributors.headline: Health Education Advisor at KIT Royal Tropical Institute

projects.title: Acting in an uncertain world: mapping public health responses to the Zika epidemic in Brazil
projects.description:
This project seeks to produce a real-time analysis of how public health institutions in Brazil are responding to the ongoing Zika epidemic, in particular how knowledge about the infection is co-evolving with new practices of clinical care and changing social imaginaries of the disease. 
The focus of our project is the research, clinical and public health activities conducted by the network of Fiocruz institutes during the first four years of the Zika epidemic (2015-2018). Our aims are 1) to produce an overview of data-gathering and knowledge making activities across the multiple Fiocruz research centres, 2) to feed this analysis back into Fiocruz and civil society stakeholders engaged in the current public health effort, and 3) to develop a series of training and educational resources to inform public health actors of the broader social, political and historical dimensions shaping public health
responses to emerging, uncertain medical threats.
The project brings together researchers at the Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz), the preeminent public health research institution In Brazil, with social scientists and historians at the Institute for Science, Innovation and Society at University of Oxford (lead UK Institution) and the Department of Global Health and Social Medicine at King’s College London.
Funding: Newton Fund

contributors.headline: Health Education Advisor at KIT Royal Tropical Institute

projects.title: Detox, a folk system on the internet
projects.description:
Several narratives about "toxins" and various "removal" processes of them from the organism circulate on the Internet, in a tense and contradictory relationship with biomedical sciences. We hypothesize that these narratives constitute a particular thinking style, with its own collectives of thought, experts and epistemology. This project aims to study the narratives from the theory of social representations' perspective, collecting and analysing the textual and visual content posted on the Internet.
Funding: Universal CNPq 2016.

authors.headline: Health Education Advisor at KIT Royal Tropical Institute

profile_positions.description: Recently part of Global Health Advisory team at the KIT Royal Tropical Institute, in the Netherlands, I joined the Education team on coordinating their Master on Public Health Programme, where I also teach and supervise healthcare workers from all the Global South. Besides, I am also involved in research projects on health systems strengthening in LMICs, with particular focus on the role of public engagement, data science and governance in Latin American and Caribbean region.
profile_positions.title: Global HealthAdvisor

profile_positions.description:
- Researcher for the Covid19 and Social Sciences in Latin America taskforce, developing STS studies on data governance, digital methods, scientometrics and altimetric. (since Feb 2020)
- Executive coordinator and researcher on Social Sciences and Zika Network, taking part in national and international projects (funded by EC, Newton Fund, CAPES, CNPq, Wellcome Trust, etc.) related to production and circulation of scientific knowledge on health emergencies amongst different stakeholders and society (since October 2016).
- Consultant for the Program of Management and Healthcare Attention (maintained by the Vice Presidency of Research and Reference Laboratories), addressing issues regarding the social impact of research, science, technology and innovation in health (2017-2018)
- Coordinator of projects related to the policies and training of health professionals for mental related issues on the primary care system, developed in collaboration with the municipal government and other academic institutions (since December 2015)
- Guest Researcher on Primary Care Laboratory at Joaquim Venâncio Politechnical School of Health, and teacher on courses related to STS, the medicalisation of society, public engagement and social impacts of health science research (since 2010)
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

company.name: UERJ - Rio de Janeiro State University

profile_positions.location: Rio de Janeiro e Região, Brasil
profile_positions.description:
- Associate Professor at Social Medicine Institute (IMS) - Health policy, planning and management department.
- Member of BIOMEDSCI - Group for social studies in technoscience and health
- Member of LAPPIS - Laboratory of research on integrality and practices in health 
- Coordinator of IMS IRB/IEC
- Co-editor of Physis Journal of Collective health
- Teacher, researcher, supervisor and lecturer in public and collective health issues (undergraduation, Master and PhD programme)
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description: At Wageningen University & Research / Public Administration and Policy group, I do a postdoctoral research entitled “Tracking facts, uncertainties and public engagement on the web: contributions of imagery to digital tools”, aiming to build and establish a digital method for mapping, analysing and interacting with imagery content of health-and food-related topics discussed on the Internet. This research is part of the project “Travelling of Framed Facts and Uncertainties (TOFU): a dashboard of imagination for innovations in food, packaging, energy, and health-technologies”, coordinated by Dr Tamara Metze, and seeks to contribute to the discussion about new communication technologies, digital media, and social perceptions of food and health practices, technologies and risks.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.location: Rio de Janeiro e Região, Brasil
profile_positions.description: Guest psychologist, lecturer and teacher on programmes and courses on clinical, social and educational psychology.
